required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Etoricoxib Prescribing Patterns and Adverse Events of Interest in Primary Care in the United Kingdom (MK-0663-162 AM1)
clinical_study.official_title: Etoricoxib Prescribing Patterns and Adverse Events of Interest During Etoricoxib Treatment in UK Primary Care; an Updated Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: This postmarketing study was conducted to describe prescribing patterns for etoricoxib (ARCOXIA®) in General Practice and describe the incidence of selected adverse events recorded in the United Kingdom (UK) Medicines and Health Care Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) General Practice Research Database (GPRD).

primary_outcome.time_frame: At first prescription (during a time period up to 13.75 years)
At first prescription (during a time period up to 13.75 years)
At first prescription (during a time period up to 13.75 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events of Special Interest Among Etoricoxib Users
primary_outcome.time_frame: During a time period up to 13.75 years

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At first prescription (during a time period up to 13.75 years)

arm_group.description: First Etoricoxib Prescription, Apr. 1, 2002 to Feb. 17, 2005
First Etoricoxib Prescription, Feb. 18, 2005 to Dec. 31, 2015
One prescription during the Period 1 and, at least, one etoricoxib prescription during Period 2.

intervention.description: As per routine clinical practice in the United Kingdom

study_pop.textblock: All participants in the MHRA's Full Feature GPRD (FF-GPRD) who have at least one electronic outpatient prescription record for etoricoxib issued by a General Practitioner during the period (April 1, 2002 to December 31, 2015) at the date of query execution against the FF-GPRD data warehouse.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients in the MHRA's Full Feature GPRD (FF-GPRD) who have at least one electronic outpatient prescription record for etoricoxib issued by a General Practitioner during the period (April 1, 2002 to December 31, 2015) at the date of query execution against the FF-GPRD data warehouse.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not registered in a GPRD-contributing practice that had continuously
collected data deemed to be 'up-to-standard' for research purposes from 1 April 2002 through to 31 December 2015.
- Never registered as a permanent patient of a General Practitioner in the practice
- Registration details were not acceptable (i.e. incomplete data or logically implausible dates)
- Not registered with a General Practitioner for at least 365 days before the date that the patient's first etoricoxib prescription was recorded in the GPRD
